thread.title: Nietes confident vs Mexican foe
thread.title_full: Nietes confident vs Mexican foe | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Nick Giongco
title: Nietes confident vs Mexican foe
text:
by Nick Giongco
October 14, 2015 Los Angeles — Filipino champion Donnie Nietes is so confident of his chances that he needs no help from anyone when he defends his World Boxing Organization (WBO) light-flyweight title for the eighth time this Saturday night at the StubHub Center.
When Mexican Juan Alejo arrived Tuesday, Nietes politely brushed aside the suggestions of two Manila scribes that he will need their help to get the job done.
Hall of Fame trainer Freddie Roach strikes a pose with Filipino fighters Mark Magsayo, Donnie Nietes, Prince Albert Pagara and Jason Pagara who are seeing action this Saturday night in Carson, California. (Nick Giongco)
“Pabayaan nyo na lang ako,” said Nietes on Tuesday as he let loose a one-two combination at the heavy bag, imagining it was his challenger and not an inanimate object.
On the penultimate day of his last training, Nietes was in an upbeat mood alongside the three other stablemates at the Wild Card Boxing Club in Hollywood.
From the looks of it, Nietes has done everything needed to ensure victory but the 33-year-old Negros-born battler is not taking Alejo lightly.
“Counter-puncher talaga,” said Nietes, mimicking how Alejo throws his punches and his tendency to just stare and wait for an opening.
“Oras na sumuntok ka, siguradong bibitaw din sya,” he said.
But Nietes believes he has Alejo all figured out that he is already looking forward to a sidetrip to Florida later in the month to attend the WBO convention.
This weekend’s big show is Nietes’ US debut and he intends to make it extra memorable, the one that will stand out even as three other stablemates are also seeing action.
Super-lightweight Jason Pagara faces Santos Benavides of Nicaragua, while super-bantam Prince Albert clashes with William Gonzalez, also of Nicaragua and feather Mark Magsayo Yardley Suarez of Mexico.
